pageContext.claim: “We just signed a trade agreement with Mexico, and it's a terrific agreement for everybody. It's been in the works for a long time. It's an agreement that a lot of people said couldn't be done, and we did something, and it was very special. Great for our farmers, our workers.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump announced an informal trade agreement with Mexico to replace NAFTA. But he needs Congress to approve any change to NAFTA, and that hasn't happened. The U.S. is still negotiating with Canada. So it's inaccurate to claim Trump "signed a trade agreement with Mexico."
